intro: Spilanthes chamaecaula, commonly known as the smallflower bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, characterized by its small, cruciform flowers and capsule fruits. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and is often found in desert or semi-desert environments. Its leaves are pinnately divided, and it produces yellow or white flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Spilanthes chamaecaula is also known for its medicinal properties, with some traditional uses involving its bitter-tasting flowers.
